channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: White House Condemns Tucker Carlson Interview With Holocaust Revisionist
item.description: Mr. Carlson’s guest on “Tucker on X” made a variety of false claims about the Holocaust and World War II.

item.title: Twitter Changed Soccer. There’s a Risk X Will Do It Again.
item.description: The world’s most popular pastime has been irrevocably shaped by its exposure to social media. That evolution can still go awry.

item.title: OnlyFans owner has made $1 billion in dividends since 2021
item.description: OnlyFans Ltd. has been growing rapidly since the start of the pandemic, with its owner raking in $1 billion in dividends over the last three years.

item.title: Sergio Mendes, 83, Dies; Brought Brazilian Rhythms to the U.S. Pop Charts
item.description: A pianist, composer and arranger, he rose to fame with the group Brasil ’66 and remained a force in popular music for more than six decades.

item.title: Fire at School Dormitory in Kenya Kills at Least 17 Students
item.description: At least 70 students are still unaccounted for, although officials urged people not to jump to conclusions about their fate.

item.title: Zuck is winning 2024: No one has gained more wealth this year than Mark Zuckerberg, who is up $56 billion
item.description: With Nvidia stock dropping this week, Zuckerberg overtook his fellow tech CEO Jensen Huang.

item.title: What We Know About the Apalachee High School Shooting
item.description: A teenager is accused of killing two students and two teachers in the deadliest school shooting in Georgia’s history. His father was arrested, too.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: American Woman Shot and Killed at West Bank Protest
item.description: Aysenur Eygi, an Turkish American woman from Seattle, was demonstrating against Jewish settlements in the town of Beita on Friday when she was shot in...

item.title: I’ve led multiple tech ventures. This is the biggest mistake startup leaders make
item.description: Startup leaders obsessed with valuations and technology overlook something more important at their peril.

item.title: Teen and Father Charged With Georgia School Shooting Appear in Court
item.description: The 14-year-old’s father was arrested Thursday in connection with the deaths of two teachers and two students, which his son is accused of carrying ou...

item.title: Hamas’s Release of Hostage Videos Inflames Divisions in Israel
item.description: The fourth recording in as many days of a hostage killed in Gaza has added to pressure on the Israeli government to reach a cease-fire deal with Hamas...

item.title: Darktrace CEO and former Mike Lynch protégé Poppy Gustafsson steps down before $5.3 billion takeover completes
item.description: Darktrace announced cofounder Gustafsson, who worked for Mike Lynch at Autonomy, would be stepping down with immediate effect.

item.title: How Elon Musk Is Influencing Donald Trump
item.description: Their fast-evolving political friendship has become a potential minefield, as Mr. Musk’s sprawling businesses may present conflicts of interest if Mr....

item.title: Distracted and Divided, Russian Security Service Misses Threats
item.description: The Ukrainian offensive over the border caught Moscow’s intelligence agencies by surprise, experts say. It wasn’t the first time that has happened dur...

item.title: In 6 years I’ve bootstrapped my moving company to $100M in revenue. Avoiding VC funding has been key
item.description: Piece of Cake Moving has grown from one truck to more than 350 under founder and CEO Voyo Popovic.
